title: Killing mithril dragons

properties.name: description
properties.value: The profit rate assumes 20 kills per hour. Your actual profit may be higher or lower depending on your speed.

content:
Killing mithril dragons
Requirements
Skills
  • 80+ recommended
  • 80+ , , recommended for Melee
  • 80+ recommended for Ranged
  • 75+ recommended for Magic
  • 43+ (70+ recommended, especially for Melee)
Items
  • High-level weaponry and decent armour
  • Anti-dragon shield or Dragonfire shield
  • Games necklace
  • Divine ranging/Magic/Divine super combat potion
  • 1-2 (Extended) Antifires
  • 4-5 Prayer potions
  • A Saradomin brew and Super restore (optional)
  • An emergency teleport (optional)
  • Rest monkfish or better
    • Quest
    None
    Other
    • Started Barbarian Firemaking
    • 55 for Broad bolts recommended if using Ranged (optional)
    • 45 (optional for player-made chapel to restore Prayer)
    • Completed Barbarian Smithing and Tai Bwo Wannai Trio to use Zamorakian hasta in Melee (optional)
    Results
    ProfitExperience gained
    147,618 21,500 7,167
    Inputs (238,125)Outputs (385,743)
    20 × Prayer potion(4) (200,300)1.25 × Extended antifire(4) (180)100 × Monkfish (36,800)1 × Games necklace(8) (845)60 × Mithril bar (44,940)20 × Dragon bones (43,260)0.002 × Draconic visage (7,842)0.0025 × Dragon full helm (161,226)10.31 × Runite bolts (2,166)1.87 × Rune battleaxe (45,987)0.47 × Rune mace (3,843)80.15 × Blood rune (25,008)15.31 × Rune dart(p) (5,083)3.75 × Rune knife (1,425)0.31 × Rune spear (3,708)7.81 × Soul rune (1,195)3.75 × Rune arrow (187)3.75 × Rune javelin (637)0.94 × Runite bar (11,659)14.06 × Dragon javelin heads (13,994)2.66 × Shark (2,300)0.16 × Rune full helm (3,219)2,321 × Coins (2,321)3,743 × Rare drop table (3,743)0.31 × Prayer mix(2) (1,687)0.31 × Superattack mix(2) (51.25)0.31 × Super def. mix(2) (83.13)0.31 × Super str. mix(2) (177)

    The profit rate assumes 20 kills per hour. Your actual profit may be higher or lower depending on your speed.

    As with Brutal green dragons, Mithril dragons may also be found in the Ancient Cavern accessible after players have started Barbarian Firemaking training. They have 100% drops of dragon bones and 3 mithril bars, thus making them worth over 4,410 coins per kill. Players should use the correct protection prayer corresponding to their weakness. For example, a player wearing Verac's armour, which is Melee armour, should use Protect from Magic. Additionally, players using Ranged or Magic from afar should have Protect from Missiles on.

    Depending on setup, skills and inventory space, players can expect around four dragons' worth of loot a trip before using an Amulet of glory to teleport to Edgeville for banking, going to Edgeville Monastery to restore Prayer points, and heading back to Ancient Cavern via the Games necklace. Alternatively, if players have at least 45 Construction, they can construct an oak altar in their chapel and use House teleport tablets instead to restore Prayer before going back.

    Due to constantly changing prices on the Grand Exchange, some information in this article may or may not be current.
    It is strongly recommended to check the live prices on the Grand Exchange before making large investments in any method.
    All prices on this page are cached, meaning it is possible that they appear out of date.
    To force a new cache of this page, click this link.
    If a money making method is out of date, you can edit it or leave a message on the talk page.

|Details =
'''The profit rate assumes 20 kills per hour. Your actual profit may be higher or lower depending on your speed.'''

As with [[Brutal green dragon]]s, [[Mithril dragon]]s may also be found in the [[Ancient Cavern]] accessible after players have started [[Barbarian Training#Barbarian Firemaking|Barbarian Firemaking]] training. They have 100% drops of [[dragon bones]] and 3 [[mithril bar]]s, thus making them worth over {{NoCoins|{{GEP|Dragon bones}}+{{GEP|Mithril bar|3}}}} coins per kill. Players should use the correct [[protection prayer]] corresponding to their weakness. For example, a player wearing [[Verac's armour]], which is [[Melee armour]], should use [[Protect from Magic]]. Additionally, players using [[Ranged]] or [[Magic]] from afar should have [[Protect from Missiles]] on.

Depending on setup, skills and inventory space, players can expect around four dragons' worth of loot a trip before using an [[Amulet of glory]] to teleport to [[Edgeville]] for banking, going to [[Edgeville Monastery]] to restore [[Prayer points]], and heading back to Ancient Cavern via the [[Games necklace]]. Alternatively, if players have at least 45 [[Construction]], they can construct an [[oak altar]] in their [[chapel]] and use [[House teleport]] tablets instead to restore Prayer before going back.
}}
